entry.et: Latin jocus; perhaps akin to Old High German gehan to say, Sanskrit yācati he asks

def.dt: :something said or done to provoke laughter
:a brief oral narrative with a climactic humorous twist
:the humorous or ridiculous element in something
:an instance of jesting :kidding can't take a joke
:something not to be taken seriously :a trifling matter consider his skiing a joke Harold Callender often used in negative constructions it is no joke to be lost in the desert
:to make the object of a joke :kid
:a joke for or about a select group of people
:a prank intended to trick or embarrass someone or cause physical discomfort
